contextId.information: Jerusalem is referred to as "her" and "she." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: I have placed her

contextId.information: The "end" is spoken of as if it were a robber attacking the people. AT: "your life is finished" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: the end is upon you

contextId.information: The judgment that is coming is treated as if it were an enemy waking up from sleep. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: The end has woken up against you

contextId.information: Disaster is spoken of as if it could move by itself. AT: "One disaster after another will happen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: Disaster upon disaster will come

contextId.information: This speaks of Yahweh not holding back his sword from attacking people as if his sword were a person that was no longer holding itself back from attacking. AT: "and I will not put it back in its sheath again" (UDB) or "I will not hold back from attacking people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: It will no longer hold back

contextId.information: This speaks of Yahweh's sword attacking his people as if the sword itself were the attacker. AT: "I will use my sword to kill my people! I will bring it against all" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: that sword has come against my people! It is against all

contextId.information: The word "her" refers to Jerusalem. Cities were often thought of as a woman. This continues through verse 32. (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_gendernotations]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]]).
contextId.quote: her ... herself

contextId.information: This speaks of the survivors being burned by fire as if the fire were a fire animal attacking and eating them. This can be stated in active form. AT: "will be burned by fire" or "fire will burn your survivors" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]] and  [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]]))
contextId.quote: will be devoured by fire

contextId.information: This personifies Jerusalem as a person who murdered the people and chose where to put their blood. AT: "They were murdered on the smooth rocks; not on the dirt where the dust would hide their blood" or "Their blood fell on the smooth rocks; it did not fall on the ground where the dust would cover it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: She has set it on the smooth rock; she has not poured it out on the ground to cover it with dust

contextId.information: This speaks of Yahweh judging the people for their ways as if their "ways" were actually judging them. AT: "I will judge you by your activities and your ways" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: As your ways were, and as your activities, they will judge you

contextId.information: Here the city of Moab is spoken of as with the masculine pronoun "his." AT: "starting at its cities" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: starting at his cities

contextId.information: The city of Tyre is spoken of here as if it were a woman. AT: "Tyre will become" or "It will become." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: She will become

contextId.information: What Yahweh would do to Tyre is compared to people going to the grave and cities falling into ruin. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: then I will bring you down to the people of ancient times, like the others who have gone down into the pit; for I will make you live in the lowest realms of the earth as in ruins of ancient times

contextId.information: "I will put Egypt into the power of desolation and waste." Desolation and waste are spoken of as if they were people who could be given power over Egypt. AT: "I will cause Egypt to become a desolate waste" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: I will give the land of Egypt over to desolation and waste

contextId.information: The day is spoken of as if it were able to keep its own light from shining. AT: "the day will be dark" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: the day will hold back its light

contextId.information: Yahweh tells Ezekiel to speak to Mount Seir as if it could hear him. The message is for all of the people of Edom. AT: "Listen, Mount Seir, I will strike you with my hand and make you a desolation and a horror because of what your people did" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: Behold! I am against you, Mount Seir, and I will strike you with my hand and make you a desolation and a horror

contextId.information: Here "you" refers to Mount Seir, but the message is for the people of Edom. The abstract noun "desolation" can be stated as an adjective. AT: "Because of what your people did I will make you desolate" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: I will make you a desolation

contextId.information: Yahweh continues telling Ezekiel to speak to Mount Seir as if it could hear him. The message is for the people of Edom. AT: "I will make you, Mount Seir, and all of Edom desolate" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: You will become a desolation, Mount Seir, and all of Edom

contextId.information: God wants Ezekiel to speak to the mountains as if they were people. The message is for the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: prophesy to the mountains of Israel

contextId.information: Experiencing shame is spoken of as if the mountains could bear shame. AT: "the peoples will no longer cause you to feel ashamed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: you will no longer have to bear the shame of the peoples
